column4: md5sum checked out. CD just didn't work on install. Like I said, froze up before installation had a chance to begin. Ubuntu's orange progress bar started to move and froze up @ less than 1/4 the way to the end.
Is Linux really ready to be used or is it still for developers? I mean, if I'm having this much trouble installing, shouldn't I stick with Windows?
generally speaking, Ubuntu is a rather straightforward install.
you could have a scratched CD, a messed up disc drive, or the ISO you downloaded could be corrupt.
